citRespParty.rpOrgName: The Maryland-National Capital Park & Planning Commission - Prince George's County

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This coverage represents the official boundaries of the twenty-eight municipalities in Prince George's County. This information is suitable for presentation at a scale of 1:2,400 and is actively maintained by the Planning Department. More information is available at https://msa.maryland.gov/msa/mdmanual/36loc/pg/html/pgmu.html
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Municipal boundaries of Prince George's County, Maryland

idPoC.rpOrgName: The Maryland-National Capital Park & Planning Commission - Prince George's County

Consts.useLimit: Creative Commons Attribution CC BY https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/. You can copy, modify, distribute, and perform analysis on the data, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission, but please provide attribution to the Prince George's County Planning Department. The Planning Department makes no warranties about the data, and disclaims liability for all uses of the data, to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law.

mdMaint.maintNote: Last metadata review date: As needed

prcStep.stepDesc: Altered the boundary for Bowie by removing the property for the Lidl at 13401 Annapolis Rd.
Mayor names updated.

4/8/2010 - City of Laurel adopted an annexation resolution effective March 24, 2010. The annexed area is approximately 4.25 acres of land located on the southwest corner of Van Dusen Road and Olive Branch way.
Updated due to Municipal annexations.
Revision along the Greenbelt Municipal boundary based on the City of Greenbelt description represented by the Planning director of the city.
Adjustment on a line in the boundary of city of Hyattsville.
Mayor name change for City of Colmar Manor.
Boundary modified for the city of Colmar Manor to reflect the municipal annexation resolution #R-1-2009.
Updated the boundary of the City of Bladensburg due to adopted annexation resolution R-1-2008.
Updated mayor names.
Updated the City of Bowie area due to an adopted annexation resolution (R-1-11) by City of Bowie.

The Town of Landover Hills has adopted an annexation resolution which became effective May 20, 2011. The annexed area is all properties along the south side and the AMF Bowling Center on the north side of Annapolis Road, from 68th Place to Baltimore/Washington PKWY, including properties along 68th Place and all portions of Annapolis Road that are adjacent to the town of Landover Hills.
Correction made to the boundary line of the City of Laurel along upper northeast part of the city.
Mayors names updated for Edmonton, Hyattsville, Fairmount Heights, Forest Heights, and Brentwood.

The Town of Forest Heights has adopted an annexation resolution (R-1-2010) which became effective December 5, 2010. The annexed area is approximately 2.96 acres of land located on the west side of Indian Head Hwy and south side of Audrey Lane known as parcels 9 and 51 on tax map 95.
Eagle Harbor mayor name updated. General review of features for topologic correctness.
Updated the mailing address for City of Bowie.
Edits made around the City of Bowie area due to adopted annexation resolution R-11-12 by the City of Bowie.

City of Laurel adopted an annexation resolution, effective September 7, 2012, for the area on the northeast of Van Dusen Road and Virginia Manor Road, approximately 62.3 acres of land. Also, added parcel 49 to the town of Forest Heights according to 1963 annexation.
Updated to reflect adopted municipal annexation by city of Laurel R-2-2012.
Updated to reflect the latest city of New Carrollton municipal annexation R-1-2012.

Updated to reflect City of College Park latest adopted municipal annexation resolution R-1-13, effective March 29, 2013, annexing approximately 4.43 acres of land located on the southwest corner of Campus Drive and Mowatt Lane.
A revision was made in the area of Mount Oak Road and Man O War Drive to follow property lines.
Revision made to reflect City of Bowie municipal annexation R-56-13.
Update to reflect City of Cheverly adopted annexation CA-3-13.

Municipality boundary for the City of Bowie amended based on adopted annexation resolution R-7-14, effective May 22, 2014, annexing approximately 39.33 acres of land located east of Chestnut Ave, south of Adnell subdivision and north of the Amtrak Northeast Corridor Railroad tracks.
Updated to reflect City of Bowie latest adopted municipal annexation R-14-14.
Update to reflect the latest City of Laurel adopted annexations 1-2014 and 2-2014.
Cheverly boundary revised to reflect changes in underlying property.
Added fields for EXECUTIVE_SELECTION and EXEC_TERM_EXPIRE

There were two edits to the shape for the City of Bowie. 1. From the Bowie City Council Resolution R-5-15. The City of Bowie annexed Parcel 316 (PG Tax Map 37), Bowie Veterinary Properites, LLC, 6700 Laurel Bowie Road, Bowie, MD 20715. Annexation letter recieved on January 13, 2015 2. From the Bowie City Council Resolution R-66-15. The City of Bowie annexed Parcels 2, 133, 87, 91 and 96 (PG Tax Map 46), TLBT, LLC, 13401 Annapolis Road, Bowie, MD 20720. Annexation letter recieved on September 15, 2015.
The one-, half-, and quarter-mile buffers for the municipalities were updated to to reflect the recent annexations by the City of Bowie.
The officials names were updated and the executive selection and term expiration dates were added from http://msa.maryland.gov/msa/mdmanual/36loc/pg/html/pgmu.html

UPPER MARLBORO: James Storey replaced Steve F. Sonnett as Mayor of Largo in the OFFICIALS_NAME field to reflect recent elections. The EXEC_TERM_EXPIRE field for Largo was updated to 1/1/2018 from 1/1/2016 to reflect recent elections.
NEW CARROLLTON: The municipal boundary for the City of New Carrollton was edited to include the West Lanham Hills Volunteer Fire Department property (tax accounts 2274231 and 2276889) from the description in exhibits A and B from the letter dated January 6, 2016 from the City of New Carrollton

The boudnary for Mount Rainier was amended to include portions of Queens Chapel Road (MD 500) and Chillum Road (MD 500) by the City of Mount Rainier. The annexation was approved by the City of Mount Rainier in Annexation Resolution 1-2001 and was effective as of January 17, 2002.
Added field for TELEPHONE and added contact telephone numbers for each municiplality per request of County 311 services.

Cheverly: Parcel 112, Liber 36876, Folio 86 (6301 Kilmer Street) was annexed into the Town of Cheverly in the resolution CAR-1-2017 effective on August 27, 2017. The 1/4, 1/2, and 1 mile municipal buffers were also updated for the Town of Cheverly.
Laurel: Two parcels were added via annexation. The addresses for the annexed properties are 7041 Contee Road and 7051 Contee Road and are described in the City of Laurel First 2017 Annexation, Annexation Plan, and Charter Resolution No. 171 effective September 12, 2017. The 1/4, 1/2, and 1 mile municipal buffers were also updated for the City of Laurel.
A repair geometry was run on a local copy of all features and used to replace all existing features in the master SDE copy.

Municipal Boundary for the City of Bowie updated based on adoption of resolution R-61-17, effective October 12, 2017, annexing approximately 74 acres of land consisting of parcel 78 (tax map 54) and a portion of the right of way of US Route 50 between Collington Road and Church Road

Updated Official’s Name and Term Expiration for Seat Pleasant, Forest Heights, Riverdale Park, Cottage City, Fairmount Heights, Glenarden, North Brentwood, Edmonston, Mount Rainier, Eagle Harbor, Bladensburg, Greenbelt, College Park.
Update to the Riverdale Park boundary to account for adjustment to parcel D on tax map043A2.
Municipal Boundary for the City of Greenbelt updated based on adoption of Resolution No. 2058, Book 8, effective February 26, 2018, annexing 0.131 acres of land consisting of parcel 192 (taxmap 25).

Municipal Boundary for the City of Bowie updated based on adoption of Resolution R-28-18, effective July 19. 2018, annexing 400.9921 acres of land in the Prince George's Stadium area (Part of Parcel A, Parcels 5, 6, 12, and 24, and a portion of the Governor Bridge Road Right of Way).
Added City of Bowie Annexation Plan - (R-70-18/R-71-18) according to legal description and accompanying map.

Detailed annexations and boundaries were created for Laurel, District Heights, and Greenbelt. To account for these adjustments, these three municipal boundaries and buffers were updated. Additionally, since Greenbelt borders Berwyn Heights, College Park, New Carrollton, and Riverdale Park, their respective boundaries and buffers were updated to account for shared boundary adjustments. These shared boundary adjustments were minor and do not result in substantial differences in acreage or affected parcels. Additionally, OFFICIALS_NAME and EXEC_TERM_EXPIRE was updated to reflect 2018 elections.
Email address information was added, where possible, usually being the town or city administrator.
Added email address for Town of Eagle Harbor.
Added City of Hyattsville Resolution 2019-01 (effective April 18th 2019).
Annexation 01-2016 for Forest Heights approved through court opinion dated April 5, 2019.

Boundary for City of New Carrollton edited to reflect annexation resolution 19-15, Annexation of Good Luck Rd, Harland St., and Sunset Terrace Properties, effective 6/17/2019. Several official's records reviewed and updated based on term expirations.
Changed address for College Park to 8400 Baltimore Avenue, Suite 375.
Amended the boundary for Largo per annexation resolution 01-2019, enacted August 27, 2019 and effective October 11, 2019.
Updated for the 8th extenstion of the Town of Forest Heights, annexation 01-2019, effective 11/21/2019.
Updated elected officials. Added Seat Pleasant annexation R-21-10.
Revised the Town of Largo limits based on Annexation Resolution 01-2021 for the second and third annexations, passed 10/12/2021 and enacted on 12/28/2001.
Forest Heights Annexation 01-2021 added, adopted October 20, 2021 and effective December 4, 2021.
Updated Mayor/Adminstrator names.

The Town of Largo passed Annexation Resolution 01-2021, making “Area 2” part of the Town of Largo. “Area 3” from that same resolution is currently being litigated and is probably going to be withdrawn. Until we get official word that “Area 3” has been added to the Town of Largo that area is being removed from the Largo Municipal area. The Town of Cheverly’s boundary has been corrected, by removing lots 25, 26 and 5 in Block 8, as well as by removing lot 5 in the Cheverly Gardens Subdivision.
Updated address for College Park.
Updated the executive for College Park to Mayor Pro Tem Denise Mitchell .
Revised the Town of Eagle Harbor Municipal Boundary to include Tax Map 183, Parcel 9 (18610 Trueman Point Rd) per Annexation Resolution No. 01-2017, effective August 8, 2017.

prcStep.stepRat: Corrections made for Capitol Heights boundary to match property line edits and to correct the municipal boundary in the vicinity of Brook Road and Riba Court.

prcStep.stepDesc: New Carrollton boundary updated based on research of boundary and property updates.
Updated the Town of Forest Hieghts 10th extension, Resolution 11-23, effective June 3, 2023.
Updates made to municipality executives.
Added New Carrollton Annexation 19-17.
Added Landover Hills annexation R-01-2024.
Added Town of Forest Heights Annexation 01-24.
Various minor edits to boundaries to match underlying property edits, where appropriate.

Edits made to the Town of Morningside, based on the de-annexation R-2004-01, effective June 29, 2004, removing portions of the street and certain addresses for English Court, John Street, Mekeldin Drive, Norfolk Court, and George Street.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Contact email for the Municipality, which is often the town clerk or the town administrator.
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
